III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section Intervention standards and prohibitions
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff and supervisors are abusing a youth daily. They have
grabbed this youth by the neck, choked, and hit him. The youth
has marks all of their body from the abuse. The most recent
incident report was from 5/20/25 when a staff grabbed the youth
around the neck and the youth did not have any injuries as a
result.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on May 22, 2025,
and reported after talking with two other individuals to gain
information on Youth A to complete her assessment on Youth
A she learned Youth A has a history of making false
allegations, very similar to what Youth A reported to her.
Complainant stated the two individuals she spoke with were not
affiliated with Wolverine Center. Complainant described both
individuals telling her Youth A wants to return home and has made
several false statements about staff members that have been
reported, investigated and found to be untrue.
Youth A was interviewed via telephone on May 22, 2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker who was face to face with
Youth A at the facility. Youth A denied ever getting choked or hit
by any staff member while at the facility. Youth A reported if a
staff member ever hurt him, he would tell Supervisor. Youth A
stated he could not recall having any marks or bruises on his body
since being at the facility.
Supervisor was interviewed via telephone on May 22, 2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker who was face to face with
Youth A at the facility. Supervisor denied ever seeing any staff
or supervisor grab Youth A by the neck, choke, or hit Youth A.
Supervisor stated Youth A rarely gets restrained because he is so
small. Supervisor reported Youth A is having a lot of trouble at
school because Youth A threatened to murder the principal, yelled
out in class he wanted a gun to kill himself, and has been showing
signs of physical aggression. Supervisor described having a good
rapport with Youth A and feels if a staff member or supervisor
2

were doing these things to Youth A, Youth A would tell Supervisor.
Supervisor could not recall seeing any bruises on Youth A recently
or in the past.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on May 22, 2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker who was face to face with
Youth A at the facility. Staff 1 denied ever seeing any staff or
supervisor grab Youth A by the neck, choke, or hit Youth A. Staff
1 stated he feels Youth A would tell Staff 1 if something like that
happened to him. Staff 1 reported Youth A does not get
restrained often or into physical altercations with the other youth at
the facility. Staff 1 denied seeing bruises on Youth A recently or
currently. Staff 1 described Youth A as being very smart and will
tell you about his whole day in great detail.
Therapist was interviewed via telephone on May 22, 2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker who was face to face with
Youth A at the facility. Therapist denied Youth A talking about
any staff member or supervisor grabbing him by the neck, choking
or hitting him. Therapist reported he has not observed Youth A
covered in bruises. Therapist stated Youth A has never
expressed any concerns about staff or supervisors to him.
Youth B was interviewed via telephone on May 22, 2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker who was face to face with
Youth A at the facility. Youth B stated Youth A calls him a
“nigger,” so Youth B keeps his distance from Youth A. Youth B
denied ever seeing any staff member or supervisor grab Youth A
by the neck, choke, or hit Youth A. Youth B reported he has never
seen any staff or supervisor do that to any youth at the facility.
Youth B reported he did not think he has seen any bruises on
Youth A. Youth B described the staff and supervisor at the facility
as being “okay” but he [Youth B] would rather be home.
Documents Reviewed:
• Safety Plan for Youth A. Safety plan documents: There will
be at minimal 2 staff in his bedroom when Youth A is
getting escalated. Only appropriate and approved physical
restraints will be used with Youth A if needed. If Youth A
complains of pain or any issues after a restraint have him
assessed. Youth A will utilize coping skills such as crafting
or fidget toys or going for a short walk on property to
attempt to deescalate.
• Behavior & Activity Logs for Youth A for the month of May
2025. 5/12/25 log documents Youth A had bruise on back
of arm. Youth A was asked what the bruise was from.
3

Youth A did not answer, Supervisor notified, no medical
attention needed. 5/20/25 Log does not document any
physical incident with Youth A. 5/22/25 log documents
Youth A told staff he slipped in the shower and hit his head.
No marks noted by staff. 5/27/25 log documents Youth A
was seen rubbing his back. Youth A told staff his back hurt
from playing on the playground the previous day. No
marks noted by staff. Many May log notes documented
Youth A playing on the playground at school, the
playground at the facility, playgrounds at Belle Isle Park
and Riverside Park, playing basketball, and riding a bike.
• Children’s Hospital of Michigan Discharge Report dated
5/23/25 for Youth A. Youth A was brought to the hospital
because he reported he did not feel well. No marks/bruises
noted on Youth A in the discharge report.
• PowerSchool SIS for Youth A for the month of May. Six
different dates entered describing Youth A struggling in the
classroom and being physical, verbally assaultive to staff.
No documentation of marks or bruises on Youth A’s body.
• Ascension St John Hospital Discharge Report dated
4/30/25 for Youth A. Youth A was brought to the hospital
because he reported he did not feel well. No marks/bruises
noted on Youth A in the discharge report.
• Staff 1’s personnel file. There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 1 completed CPI Refresher, CAP training, Verbal
De-escalation training, and Supportive Communication
training on 05/06/2025.
• Wolverine Human Services Policy for Prohibited
Interventions. Policy documents, “Use of physical
discipline inflicted in any manner is prohibited.”
• Restraint Incident Reports for Youth A dated, 5/01/25,
5/03/25, 5/04/25, and three on 5/11/25. No injuries were
noted in any of the reports.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews and documentation review, there was no information
provided that Youth A was being abused daily, choked, or hit and
left with marks all over his body.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
4

Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
